subject: Re: Wolper and HubSpot
preview: Hi Bass,  We are looking into this, yes, this possible but we may need to create a custom script to achieve this. The plugin that site is using is not compatible with conditional field.  This may take

full_threads.body:
Hi Bass,

We are looking into this, yes, this possible but we may need to create a custom script to achieve this. The plugin that site is using is not compatible with conditional field. This may take 30mins-1.5hrs to achieved

Hi Joel,

Thanks for this.

Can we do what we did with the Address field on Member2 to the email field as well?



Logic:
If Ticked (True), then leave email field for member2 blank. Keep email field hidden. Leave this as default.
If Unticked (False), then show email field input box for member 2 to populate. Keep the validation in place.

Is this something we can do? Thanks!

Regards,

Bass Valmonte
Hubspot Specialist

ROVER



bass@webrover.com



www.webrover.com

Hi Bass,

I've created a validation for member 2 email. It cannot be the same with the member 1 email.

Hi Joel,

That's great! Yes we can use that but the issue is, member 2 might use the same email as the member 1 previously entered in the form. if that happens, There will be duplicate record, or member 1 record will be overwritten by member 2 data, or member 2 record will not be created at all because it has the same email as the member 1.

this is what we are trying to avoid.

Hubspot can only make 1 record per email address and in the case of Wolper, some members share 1 email address in 1 household (wife, husband, daughter, etc.)

My initial thought was either,
- create a validation where when member 2 email input the same email as member 1, then email of member 2 will not be pushed to Hubspot.
- hide member 2 email field, create a checkbox to ask if member 2 will be using the same email as member 1, then if they answer NO, email field will be visible.

Something like that. What are your thoughts?

Regards,

Bass Valmonte
Hubspot Specialist

ROVER



bass@webrover.com



www.webrover.com

Hi Bass,

I hope you are doing well.

Upon checking there is a another email for member 2 details. So you could use that for creating a contact.

Hey Joel,

How are you?

I have a question. Can we put a validation rule on the email field of the 2nd contact creation on the form? Reason being, if the email of the 2nd contact is or will be the same as the 1st contacts' email, hubspot will either overwrite the 1st contact record, update the contact record, or give an error due to "duplicate record" for same email address used.

Your immediate response is greatly appreciated. Thank you.

Regards,

Bass Valmonte
Hubspot Specialist

ROVER



bass@webrover.com



www.webrover.com

Hi Michelle,

All good, its for the Webrover team to check if all the fields that they are all syncing, we are just standing by just incase they something from the site.

Thanks Joel.

As you can see I'm a bit confused.

Do you need me to check anything?

Hi Michelle,

I hope you are doing well.

Its actually for the Webrover to test if the fields that they need are working :)

Hi Joel,

Is this what I am looking for?

Hi Michelle,

Thanks again to you, Jessica, and Bass for the quick meeting earlier.

Just a quick update on the HubSpot integration — we’ve now connected it using the Gravity Forms add-on.

To test the setup, I’ve duplicated the form without Stripe integration and submitted a test entry just now. Would you be able to check if that submission has come through on your end?

Here’s the direct link to the contact record for reference:
HubSpot Contact Record

Let me know if it’s syncing as expected or if anything seems off.
Just closing this for now, waiting to here back from them

action.text: Cindy Valderama assigned to Joel Maligalig
Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Cindy Valderama

full_threads.body:
Hi Michelle,

Thanks for reaching out.

Looping in @Wolf IQ Support to help on this. Our devs can meet with Rover directly to sort the integration issues.

Do they have a calendar link we can use to book something in?

Thanks,
Andy

On Fri, Jun 20, 2025 at 12:57 PM Michelle Stockley <MichelleStockley@wolper.com.au> wrote:
Hi Heath,

Wolper has implemented HubSpot as a CRM platform.
One of the main drivers of this decision was to link our crm with the website to automate our membership renewal process and to automatically update the CRM with renewal payment details.
Our integration partner we are using - Rover - are having a few issues. This is how they describe it:

"There are some fields that aren't integrating correctly with Hubspot. It will be a quicker fix if my team and I can meet directly with the dev to resolve this."

Can they schedule a meeting with the right person at Wolf to resolve this?

Thanks,

Michelle.


MICHELLE STOCKLEY
Marketing Manager, Wolper Jewish Hospital
T: 02 8324 2233 M: 0408 600 969

8 Trelawney Street Woollahra NSW 2025
wolper.com.au
